title: grep_annotation_column
description:
Perform a regex lookup on a column from the annotation matrices .obs or .var.
The annotation matrix can originate from either a modality, or all modalities (global .var or .obs).

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: Arguments related to the input dataset.

input_layer.description: Input data to use when calculating fraction of observations that match with the query

modality.description: Which modality to get the annotation matrix from

matrix.description: Matrix to fetch the column from that will be searched

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Arguments related to how the output will be written.

output_match_column.description: Name of the column to write the result to

output_fraction_column.description:
For the opposite axis, name of the column to write the fraction of 
observations that matches to the pattern

output_compression.description: Compression format to use for the output AnnData and/or Mudata objects

regex_pattern.description: Regex to use to match with the input column

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.
